item.title: Lac Viet Bistro
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:
Every year for my brother’s birthday, he choses to have dinner at Lac Viet Bistro on Colonial. There are a lot of Vietnamese restaurants in the Mills 50 area, but Lac Viet is the place to go for an upscale evening. Every time I go, I choose the Lac Viet Special (number 55), which is […]

The post Lac Viet Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
Every year for my brother’s birthday, he choses to have dinner at Lac Viet Bistro on Colonial. There are a lot of Vietnamese restaurants in the Mills 50 area, but Lac Viet is the place to go for an upscale evening.

Every time I go, I choose the Lac Viet Special (number 55), which is the first picture in the set. It’s a bowl of vermicelli noodles with all the traditional Vietnamese ingredients: cucumbers, carrots, etc, etc. For meat, the bowl has pork, beef, and shrimp on sugar cane which is really the highlight. Shrimp on sugar cane is ground up shrimp that is spread and molded on a piece of sugar cane, and then cooked. It’s sweet and delicious. The bowl also has a fried spring roll in it. I pour in some of the sauce that comes with it and go to town.

Carla ordered a vermicelli duck soup, which was also very good thought difficult to eat. The quarter duck was all still on the bone which proves difficult if you’re eating a soup. The flavors, however, were great.

Also pictured are shrimp and tofu summer rolls which are served with a delicious peanut sauce.

Lac Viet is a great place if your looking for slightly finer Vietnamese dining. You can find them on Colonial Dr between Bumby and Mills.

The post Lac Viet Bistro appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
